title: Claës Fredrik Hornstedt examining natural history specimens, attended by his slave Ali, in Java

  physical_appearance: This painting depicts the natural historian Claës Fredrik Hornstedt
 alongside with his slave who is named as Ali
 examing several animal specimens behind a table. The background of the painting comprises of trees and the sky. The painting has a wooden frame and a pink border. Hornsted\u0027s skin is painted as pale whereas Ali\u0027s skin is painted as dark brown. Hornsted is also dressed totally in a white colonial outfit while Ali only adorns a pair of brown shorts and is barefoot. There is a crocodile and a monkey standing on the ground alongside Hornstedt and Ali. There is one dead bird on the table and another in a transparent jar.Ali is holding an animal in his hands and Hornstedt is looking at it.

  subject_terms_1: naturalists natural history colonial settlements slaves (people)

  subject_terms_2: Colonization Hornstedt
 C.F. (Clas Fredrik)
 1758 - 1809 Naturalist Slaves Natural history Watercolour painting Jakarta (Indonesia)

  subject_terms_3: Watercolour Painting Visual arts

  sgcool_label_text: \This watercolour depicts the Swedish naturalist Claës Fredrik Hornstedt examining natural history specimens. The setting for this scene is Java
 where Hornstedt spent a year between 1783 and 1784
 supported by the Batavian Society of Arts and Science. He is attended to by a slave named Ali
 as indicated in the accompanying inscription
 Ali being a name he gave to his slave in replacement of his \\long Javanese name\\. The inscription is dated 1788

metadata.title_text: Claës Fredrik Hornstedt examining natural history specimens, attended by his slave Ali, in Java
metadata.physical_appearance: This painting depicts the natural historian Claës Fredrik Hornstedt, alongside with his slave who is named as Ali, examing several animal specimens behind a table. The background of the painting comprises of trees and the sky. The painting has a wooden frame and a pink border. Hornsted's skin is painted as pale whereas Ali's skin is painted as dark brown. Hornsted is also dressed totally in a white colonial outfit while Ali only adorns a pair of brown shorts and is barefoot. There is a crocodile and a monkey standing on the ground alongside Hornstedt and Ali. There is one dead bird on the table and another in a transparent jar.Ali is holding an animal in his hands and Hornstedt is looking at it.
metadata.subject_terms_1: naturalists natural history colonial settlements slaves (people)
metadata.subject_terms_2: Colonization Hornstedt, C.F. (Clas Fredrik), 1758 - 1809 Naturalist Slaves Natural history Watercolour painting Jakarta (Indonesia)
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This watercolour depicts the Swedish naturalist Claës Fredrik Hornstedt examining natural history specimens. The setting for this scene is Java, where Hornstedt spent a year between 1783 and 1784, supported by the Batavian Society of Arts and Science. He is attended to by a slave named Ali, as indicated in the accompanying inscription, Ali being a name he gave to his slave in replacement of his ""long Javanese name"". The inscription is dated 1788
